name: Idiopathic Systemic Capillary Leak Syndrome
chief_complaint: Recurrent episodes of severe swelling, weakness, and low blood pressure
treatment: Aggressive IV crystalloid/colloid resuscitation during crises
prognosis: Guarded - 30% 5-year mortality from complications (renal failure, compartment syndrome, thromboembolism)
description: A rare, life-threatening condition characterized by recurrent episodes of capillary hyperpermeability leading to massive third-spacing of fluids, hemoconcentration, and shock. Episodes are often preceded by viral prodrome. Pathogenesis involves monoclonal gammopathy in 80% of cases and cytokine-mediated endothelial damage.
